alert.note: Alert for Johnson County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:36PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Newton and northeastern Johnson Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1036 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Devils Knob, or 19 miles north of Clarksville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walnut... Rosetta... Devils Knob... Salus... Catalpa... Fort Douglas... Ozone... Fallsville... Swain... Haw Creek Falls Campground... Dixon Ridge... Nail... Mineral Springs Recreation Area... Oark... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for western Arkansas.
